definition: many/much/often/a lot of/numerous/more/in excess/how (to what extent)/multi-/Taiwan pr. [duo2] when it means "how"
topic/problem for discussion/exam question/subject/to inscribe/to mention/CL:個|个[ge4],道[dao4]

sentences.english: Five others have multiple-choice written exams, but they are not very hard.
sentences.chinese: 其他五个州设置了多选题的笔试，但并不非常困难。

sentences.english: When asking learners to answer fill - in - the - blank or multiple-choice questions, be sure to provide directions.
sentences.chinese: 当要求学习者去回答填空或多选题时，确信提供说明。

sentences.english: Which two groups of patients receive free medicine?A. People over 17 years old.
sentences.chinese: 的一道多选题是关于能够得到免费医疗的人群的选择。

definition: to fill a job vacancy/to fill in a blank (e.g. on questionnaire or exam paper)
the subject under discussion/the point at issue
topic/problem for discussion/exam question/subject/to inscribe/to mention/CL:個|个[ge4],道[dao4]
problem or question solved for illustrative purposes in the classroom/practice question (used in preparation for an exam)/sample question
question bank (for examiners creating an exam, or students preparing for an exam)
to make a choice (between several alternatives)/a choice/an option/an alternative
